moves.1. e4: This was an interesting game, but it started with this common move.
moves.2. Nf3: I like the kings knight opening.  It develops a piece as well as results in me guarding 4 critical squares, one of which is occupied by that black pawn.
moves.2... f6: kings knight might result in a response like this, but it weakens kings side for black.  If black was worried about losing the pawn, Nc6, Qe7, or Bd6 would have done the job and developed a piece.
moves.3. d4: probably could have just taken that pawn and pull the queen out on that weak king side, but ill get there in a bit
moves.3... d6: and now blacks queen and bishop are virtually trapped.
moves.4. c3: so that might be a nice place to attack from
moves.4... g5: hmm... seems to weaken that side more
moves.5. Bc4: im dnoe with this pawn moving game, lets get this thing started.  I was thinking about creating a skewer with Qb3.  possibly getting his knight and rook for a bishop...
moves.5... Ne7: but he beat me to it, and moved his first significant piece but it was only to the 2nd row.
moves.6. Bxg5: now this may not have been the best plan, but here's my thought:  If he doesn't bite at the bishop than I take a free pawn,  If he does take it, read on...
moves.7. Nxg5: set myself up for some dinner... anyone have a fork?
moves.7... Nd5: oh you want to take my knight?
moves.8... Kd7: the other option resulted in checkmate
moves.9. Nf7: Oh great a fork! let's eat!
moves.9... Qf6: so he can take my knight...
moves.10... Qxh8: no sweat... hey what's that horse doing outside of its corral?
moves.11. Bxd5: i wrangled him... and now im thinking 'how do i end this thing mercifully?'  the end game has been my struggle of late.
moves.11... exd4: he's going to survive for awhile on that diagonal
moves.12. cxd4: i probably took that pawn one move too soon.  this would have been a good time to castle... I know many of you would say I should have done that a long time ago.
moves.12... Qxd4: so he wants my rook, but can i keep him in check for awhile?
moves.13. Qf7+: yes, at this point i have a pretty good idea about this.   Look what happened to the king side!  whites strategy was disastrous
moves.13... Be7: i figured...but my plan allows for this
moves.15. Qg8+: third straight check, but its gotta end soon
moves.15... Kd7: all those checks did was move my queen into position...
moves.16. O-O: now lets take care of this rook situation... oh yeah and keep my king safe
moves.16... Qxb2: just as i thought, but this will benefit me more than him...
moves.17... Qxc3: taken! now I will pin that queen to the king... what?  their not lined up?
moves.18. Be6+: looks like I still have some work to do.
moves.18... Kc6: no problem.  now theyre lined up
moves.19. Rfc1: pin.  I chose the king side rook because with Qe8 the kings only escape is the b file and queens rook is still available to strike from there.
moves.19... Qxc1+: sacrifice.  i have to admit, i would have felt pretty hopeless if i was black at this point.
moves.20... Kb6: he's just on the run now
moves.21. Qxc8: finally ended the bishops game.  I imagine him staring in the face of my queen, all the time watching this happen to his king.  Sad.
moves.21... c5: probably would have taken that pawn next if not for this move.  So how do I end this?  im sure ive already missed a forced mate right?
moves.22. Rb1+: another check, this will trap him on the a file
moves.22... Ka6: could have extended his life a little longer with Ka5, but its inevitable now
moves.24. Qb5#: oh yeah, now that's it.  Kind of a short game, but an interesting attack.  remember it started with that sacrificed bishop. ok, who wants to play?
